page.title: 18FISHING IN THE F. OF DEAN
page.content: YORKLEY AND DISTRICT ANGLING CLUB RENT CANNOP PONDS AND OTHER WATERS FROM THE FORESTRY COMMISSION FOR Â£1,150. CANNOP HAS 2 PONDS: NO.1 OF FIVE AND A HALF ACRES IS 3' TO 27' DEEP; NO.2 IS TWO AND A HALF ACRES AND IS LESS THAN 8' DEEP. ONCE A YEAR VOLUNTEERS CLEAR THE POND OF WEED. THE FISHERMEN FISH FROM NUMBERED PLACES CALLED 'PEGS'. IN THE POND ARE ROACH,PERCH,TROUT, TENCH, RUDD, EEL, CARP AND PIKE. ALL FISH ARE THROWN BACK EXCEPT PIKE. THE CLUB HAVE PUT 20,000 FISH IN OVER THE LAST TEN YEARS. THERE ARE 600 MEMBERS. THE JUNIOR FEE IS Â£2. AND THE SENIOR FEE Â£8. THIS PERMITS FISHING IN CLUB WATERS FROM 16TH JUNE TO 16TH MARCH. (FISHING TACKLE CAN RANGE FROM Â£10 TO Â£500).
